title: Help identify Letterpres/Wood-Type
content:
Hi typophiles,

I bought a bag of wood numbers, and on the bag a lot of this wooden type came:  
 [http://ferfolio.com/files/storage/\_MG\_9785.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717193702/http:/ferfolio.com/files/storage/_MG_9785.JPG "http://ferfolio.com/files/storage/\_MG\_9785.JPG")  
Any idea what it is?

And, here I have to typefaces for you guys to try and identify:  
 [http://ferfolio.com/files/storage/\_MG\_9782.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717193702/http:/ferfolio.com/files/storage/_MG_9782.JPG "http://ferfolio.com/files/storage/\_MG\_9782.JPG")  
(the complete serif-ish middle one, and the lower right one, with contrast)

Any help will be welcome :)
author: ferfolio_2

comments.content:
Fernando, please post this in the Type ID forum; this forum is for General Discussions only.

==\> [Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20140717193702/http:/www.typophile.com/typeid)
Sorry! Didn't know there was such a thing! Best regards
